results.title: La Fille Aux Yeux D'email
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane is still trying to operate the subitution of jewels in spite of the constant interruptions of Bicou and his best friend Jacinthe. He hopes to be out of the Opera House just in time to reach ‘L’oiseau de feu’, the cabaret owned by Morales wher he performs his dance number with Gloria. Instead, he finds himself locked up on the roof of the Opera House.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Dernier Carat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
In order to save her name and Stephane’s, Olympe negotiates the return of the jewels against immunity from prosecution. Boudot organises a television link-up between Paris and Montreal to close the investigation.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: C'est Parti!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane receives orders from Morales to substitute the jewels back on arrival in Montreal. To convince him to obey orders, Morales reminds him that Olympe is now a de facto accomplice since she is the one who cleared the jewels through customs. In Paris, Bicou and Jacinthe are in possession of a necklace without knowing that it is part of the treasure. Lulu is trying is hardest to recover them from the children.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Unhappy Customers
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Unhappy customers promptly tell others about poor service. Offers the philosophy that complaints should be welcomed so that the problem can be resolved, repeat business generated and the now satisfied customer will tell others. Illustrates a step by step method in a range of service settings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions

results.title: C'est Jeudi, Jacinthe!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Lulu and Stephane have managed to swap the last jewels in Olympe’s (the star of the ballet) dressing room. When she arrives at 8 am to pick up her luggage before going to the airport, she discovers the night watchman tied up in the shower. She immediately sounds the alert. Meanwhile, Lulu and Stephane are still trying to find a way out of the Opera House. When they do so, they bump into Jacinthe who recognises the bag from the previous night.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Selling Our Services
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Improving Service”.
All service involves selling and selling entails meeting needs by asking questions and actively listening, giving advice based on product knowledge, bending the rules and taking personal responsibility for problems.

results.title: Serving People
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Customers and clients want to be served in a positive way. Frontline staff should use greetings and names, show respect for unusual requests, be sensitive to cultural differences and overcome language barriers.

results.title: Selecting for Service
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Organisations have to select the right people to serve. Outlines six selection criteria and demonstrates selection techniques.

results.title: Getting organised to serve
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Organisations can get their “service mix” right by overhauling internal systems, removing service barriers, streamlining organisational structures and functions, and motivating staff to serve.

results.title: Service Leadership
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Exceptional service begins with senior management a service leadership involves staying in touch with the customers, leading by example, creating a “service culture” and gaining staff commitment.
